text: the situation is fairly calm at the
moment as it tends to be at this time of
the day it's just around lunchtime here
in Hong Kong but there's a lot of
attention being focused now on TV
footage air dark pictures that shows a
demonstrator who a demonstrator who was
handcuffed being led to a building by
six police officers he's shown being
thrown to the ground and then punched
and kicked for several minutes now these
images have really shocked the city
because the police force is always
prided itself on its professionalism and
experience with crowd control the
demonstrator has been identified as a
social worker Ken Zhang and a
long-standing pro-democracy activist he
and his lawyers have already made a
complaint of group police brutality to
officials here they promised to
thoroughly investigate the matter we've
also heard from the secretary of
security who said that the officers
identified in that video have been
transferred from their jobs temporarily
it'll be interesting to see if news at
this footage is which has been widely
shared on social media will be enough to
bring even more demonstrators onto the
streets this evening
